page.title: 06HOUGHTON HALL TODAY
page.content: Structurally,the house is practically as it was built.Robert Walpole's grandson,GEORGE, had the steps removed from the East and West front when he could not afford to pay for their repair.A laundry and sick quarters behind the picture gallery were destroyed by fire in the nineteenth century.Today there are steps,to the original design,on the West front, a replacement in 1973 by the now DOWAGER MARCHIONESS of CHOLMONDELEY to commemorate her husband,the fifth MARQUESS, who died in 1968. These steps are of stone from HOLLINGTON in STAFFORDSHIRE as the original AISLABY quarries are no longer working. Inside the house , pictures from the Cholmondeley collection and pictures and furniture from the collection of PHILIP SASSOON, brother of the present dowager, compensate for earlier losses
